data.title: don't want to edit file, just want to execute it.
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: win10 15063.483 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. input `somescript.py` in cmd and press Enter 
2. the VSCode show up,but I don't want it. I just want to execute the script.
3. I already set the `.py` file association
    ```cmd
    $ echo %pathext%
    .COM;.EXE;.BAT;.CMD;.VBS;.VBE;.JS;.JSE;.WSF;.WSH;.MSC;.PY
    $ assoc .py
    .py=Python.File
    $ ftype Python.File
    Python.File="python" "%1" %*
    ```
**how do i configure the VSCode to do this?**

data.title: Count extension downloads per IP

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Please, count extension downloads per IP, because somebody can execute an script to auto download an extension, cheating results.

example script:

```shell
for i in $(seq 0 1000000)
do
  code --uninstall-extension EditorConfig.EditorConfig
  sleep 0.1
  code --install-extension EditorConfig.EditorConfig
  sleep 0.1
done
```

In one night, the above script would add 1 million downloads, cheating the marketplace counter.

data.title: After clicking 'Uninstall' on an extension, it sometimes still shows up as if it is installed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
_From @qian6 on July 20, 2017 8:46_

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

- OS Name: Windows
- OS Version: 10.0.15063
- OS Platform: Windows
- RID: win10-x64
- Base Path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\1.0.4

VS Code version: 1.14.1
C# Extension version: [https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharpvscode/releases/download/v1.12.0-beta3](https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharpvscode/releases/download/v1.12.0-beta3)

## Steps to reproduce

1. Open VSCode.
2. Install .VSIX and click Reload button as following:
 ![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20922638/28407989-ac558834-6d68-11e7-8296-7921ef3e58ee.PNG)
 ![capture1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20922638/28408030-d1f4af7a-6d68-11e7-8f14-914a90c7cb03.PNG)
3. Uninstall .VSIX as following:
 ![capture3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20922638/28408109-f76787aa-6d68-11e7-90a9-00a1c9dae66c.PNG)

## Expected  behavior
![capture4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20922638/28408139-0bf46882-6d69-11e7-9f7e-83d48736737c.PNG)

## Actual behavior
![capture5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20922638/28408162-288643a8-6d69-11e7-91e1-d2c4da444781.PNG)

##Investigate

1. When I closed VSCode and again open ,VSIX had already uninstalled and not display in the UI.
2. This issue reproduce only in windows ,mac/Linux is ok.


_Copied from original issue: OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode#1651_

data.title: Expect value for staticPath different than expected in Debug Panel
data.body:
AH! 

This appears to happen a lot. Whenever I start coding again, the ghost in the machine interferes with my app. I don't want to return to work.

HA!

- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 Pro 64bit

Steps to Reproduce

1. git clone [Rescue Shelter Demo](http://github.com/kscott5/RescueShelter)
2. Open with VSCode
3. npm install & npm run compile-ts
4. Select the app.js file located in build\src folder
5. Add break point and step into server.js.
6. Review the Debug panel and hover over staticPath variable

![strange](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/132991/28445333-5f61e448-6d89-11e7-85bd-584dfb99adcc.png)

data.title: PHP Syntax broken by `@var array(string)` in a comment
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (cf9726da54472f1e268135a64abd4365b91109f4, 2017-07-20T05:07:26.027Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
puppet|Bor|0.3.2
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
vscode-intelephense-client|bme|0.7.2
vscode-phpmd|eco|1.0.1
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-symbols|lin|2.1.0
php-docblocker|nei|1.2.0
vim|vsc|0.9.0
gitblame|wad|2.0.1
vscode-open-in-github|ziy|1.2.7



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a php file with code like:

```php
<?php
/**
* @var array(string)
*/
$foo = 'bar';
```

2. Observe incorrect syntax highlighting:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1070702/28444320-ab9e1356-6dff-11e7-92fe-3dbfba48be59.png)

This started in the last few days and the current stable version doesn't do it (it's just in insiders atm):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1070702/28444300-8ab16aee-6dff-11e7-86c4-e03ae827f52c.png)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Can I put the extensionsGallery on my vscode fork?
data.body:
By default the https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode does not come with key:

    "extensionsGallery": {
        "serviceUrl": "https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/_apis/public/gallery",
        "cacheUrl": "https://vscode.blob.core.windows.net/gallery/index",
        "itemUrl": "https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items"
    }

on its https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/product.json file. That entry is required to install extensions from the marketplace as showed on:

1.  https://stackoverflow.com/questions/37143536/no-extensions-found-when-running-visual-studio-code-from-source



Also there is this commits, where their developer putted the key:

1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/b00945fc8c79f6db74b280ef53eba060ed9a1388
1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/f1d0c1d88417f85ec66fa5629beca64ef71ac8b8

But sequentially removed it justifying:

> Revert inadvertant change to product.json

Why they are removing it? Seems they are using it while developing, as we may see he let slip the line to the upper stream. Can I put it on my fork? Or I can only use it locally as they seem to be doing?

___

Related issues:

1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/60 Command "Extensions: Install Extension" missing when running vscode from source
1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2647 Command "Extensions: Install Extension" missing when running vscode from source
1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28253 Can't see extensions or load via command line
1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23831 How do I enable extensions in the extensions dir in OSS Dev mode
1. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-wiki/pull/30 Add marketplace extension installation details

data.title: VS Code High Memory Utilization

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.1
- OS Version: windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open up 5 VS Code Windows  for 5 Folders(non-git repositories. just regular visual studio folders)
2. Folder has node_modules as 1 of the folders within it (*** may be whats causing it)
2. Do nothing. Just observe the Taks Schedule Memory
3- Each VsCode.exe  takes around 700MB. After leaving it running for 20 min. 2 VS Code instances are up to 1 Gig.
4- The only thing that makes sense is that i also opened node_modules. I don't think VsCode extensions would have caused it. I'm only using the popular most downloaded VS Code extensions
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Find widget doesn't clear regex error message on toggling regex mode with keyboard shortcut
data.body:
![jul-20-2017 16-15-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/323878/28442725-af25628e-6d66-11e7-8ef2-03210379f614.gif)

- Focus find widget
- Enable regex mode
- Enter an invalid regex - oh no, error
- cmd+alt+r to disable regex mode
- Error is still present, but now I can search in non-regex mode
- And if I show/hide the find widget, the error is still there (and on top of the find widget)

If I click the regex box instead of using the keyboard shortcut, then it hides the error message as expected.

data.title: Intellisense not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 
C# + C/C++ from Microsoft

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
cpptools|ms-|0.12.1
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
latex|ms-|0.1.3
debugger-for-edge|msj|0.4.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Running any program with .cs, .tex, .cpp

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Intellisense was working recently, then it stopped working. It's kind of annoying to type EVERYTHING by hand, I think it would be nice to have Intellisense like in Visual Studio. It gets tiring typing "\documentclass{article}" and the "using System;" then "namespace {name}" then "class Program {}" then "static void Main(string[] args) {}" again and again and again. I've been using Notepad++ as a replacement until this can get fixed. It's also annoying how it doesn't recognize classes and methods that I've called by typing by hand previously. i.e. "Console.WriteLine();" over and over again. Intellisense stopped working after I did an update for VS Code and is annoying. Any way to install older versions of VS Code to get Intellisense working again maybe?

data.title: [QUESTION] Use workbench.colorCustomizations in extension?
data.body:
1. Users can customize the UI using `workbench.colorCustomizations` settings.
2. I'd like to **ship such customization in my color theme** [eppz! (C# theme for Unity)](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eppz.eppz-code).
3. How?

---

I tried to contribute these values to my **extension** (!), but nor `configuration`, nor `configurationDefaults` worked. As these customizations are actually workbench user settings, I'm actually asking **how to contribute value overrides to `settings.json` in an extension**.

---

I already setup [the very same question on stackoverflow.com](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45218663/use-workbench-colorcustomizations-in-extension).

data.title: Nav toolbar - impements #9418
data.body: Fully functional, but not very well styled navigational toolbar, as described in #9418 Feature Request : Navigation Bar like Visual Studio or Eclipse Clicking on the breadcrumb element scrolls editor and places cursor onto it. Also flashes the symbol momentarily. Neat navigation! On startup it takes a little while to appear (language service need to initialise). Then it follows cursor movement and editing of course! By relying on standard `DocumentSymbolProvider`, it just works with whatever lexical model current editor uses. Picks up deep parsing features in TypeScript, and uses dumber match editing JSON. Missing pieces -------------- **Styling** is beyond naive: just applying CSS within code. I'm keen to do it properly, but need guidance please! **Diff mode** only populates navbar for edited panel, the original code isn't decorated with navbar. It looks silly on screen, and could be helpful to enable in Diff/original too. **Everything is in one file** -- should I separate the logic from that `codeEditor` somewhere else? Any guidance is welcome! **No tests** please guide me what's the best approach here: where should tests go? More features to add ------------------- * Hover over symbol name in navbar can highlight its location in editor * Icons for different symbol kinds * Use further language service features for tooltips * Allow dropdown-like functionality for selecting and navigating to sibling symbols

data.title: JsDoc markup ignored/displayed as plain text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T18:36:31.751Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- intellij-idea-keybindings|k--|0.2.12 cpptools|ms-|0.12.1 --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Write a Jsdoc comment such as ``` /** This is a JSDoc comment *
    *
  • First Item
    • *
  • Second Item
    • *
* @description

Description tags are supposed to support HTML formatting

* @constructor * @param {Streamer} in_stream - (Optional) An "inbound" stream with data to be read. */ ``` 2. Mouse over the class/object/variable you tried to document and see that everything is rendered as plain text. VSCode will display JSDoc comments as documentation on mouseover, however with it rendering any html markup as plaintext, comments that would normally display with orderly lists, line breaks, and paragraphs is all mashed together in a cluttered mess with no new lines. For example the Jsdoc in the first step renders as: ``` Creates a Header
  • First Item
  • Second Item
@description

Description tags are supposed to support HTML formatting

@constructor @param {Streamer} in_stream - (Optional) An "inbound" stream with data to be read. ``` I did notice that if you do this: ``` /** Blah blah blah * * Own Line * * Another Line */ ``` VsCode will render this as: ``` Blah blah blah Own Line Another Line ``` when you mouseover the documented item. Note that to get "Own Line" and "Another Line" on their own lines, it took an extra blank line. Please do not render html tags in comments, or at least treat ```
,

``` etc. as new lines so that there is some semblance of formatting being applied to displayed documentation. Writing jsdoc comments that are intended to render nicely in VSCode require an inordinate amount of wasted lines just to accomplish what a```

``` or ```
``` would accomplish on the same line. With how things are now you have to pick between displaying Jsdoc documentation nicely in HTML, or have it readable in VScode, you can't have both without one or the other being poorly formatted if not unreadable. Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Editor rulers disappear at lower zoom levels
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (6afdf303bb8f70d840c12a43c036e98a9da50d41, 2017-07-05T09:01:45.828Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Zoom out the text editor one step (Cm + -)
2. Toggle the side bar so that it is visible then slowly resize it. At certain positions, the ruler dissapears.

I'm _guessing_ that this is happening because scaling is handled using a cheap algorithm that's throwing away the one-pixel ruler at certain widths. In which case it might be handy to have an `editor.rulerWidth` property so that I can set the ruler to be 2 or 3 pixels wide, etc.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature request: highlight deprecated functions (JS/TS)
data.body: It would be nice if the editor somehow highlighted functions annotated with `@deprecated`, maybe strikethrough text.

data.title: Feature request: Pre-populate lua blocks
data.body:
When a new block is detected (for example, after doing function myfunc() (enter)) the editor should automatically indent the next line and insert an extra line containing "end".

Other obvious triggers:

function ...(...)
- for  ... do
- while ...
- if ... then
- do

data.title: Trying to move new file during creation moves existing file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.0 (b8cd5b9556d8b70ea560d35b903422363f6c5c40, 2017-07-10T18:36:31.751Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vue|liu|0.1.5
csharp|ms-|1.11.0
sublime-keybindings|ms-|2.9.1
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.6
vetur|oct|0.9.1



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click New File
2. Before naming the file, click on the icon to the left of the file name input field (if it's not meant to be a "move me" icon, it certainly looks like one) and drag to move the pending file.
3. Instead of moving the pending new file, VS Code will abort new file creation and instead move the file that was in that spot before "New File" was clicked.

Optional additional step: User is very confused.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Option to start different type of terminal sh/ps1/cmd.exe
data.body:
Please create an option to start a different type of terminal session.

For example, if I want a PowerShell terminal, I have to create/open a .ps1 file before I can start it.  Currently, on Windows 10, I have my default as bash but I am doing some cross-platform testing and want to have both.

data.title: Debugger: Call Stack frame duplicate display
data.body:
_From @qian6 on July 20, 2017 9:25_

## Environment data
 dotnet --info  output:

- OS Name: Windows
- OS Version: 10.0.15063
- OS Platform: Windows
- RID: win10-x64
- Base Path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\1.0.4

VS Code version: 1.14.1
 C# Extension version: https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharpvscode/releases/download/v1.12.0-beta3

## Steps to reproduce

1. Run command to create dotnet project as following:

   dotnet new console -o hwapp
   cd hwapp
   dotnet restore
   dotnet run

2. Open hwapp project in vscode.

3. Press F5 to start debugging.

5. Observer Call Stack window.

## Expected  behavior
It can display normally.

## Actual behavior
![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20922638/28410314-dcd16648-6d6f-11e7-9ffd-7bdffdb1f902.PNG)

data.title: 32 bit Linux build agent
